The IC 50 values inhibiting cell proliferation were determined, and the results are summarized in Table 2. The results showed that polygonumins A exhibited cytotoxicity against all tested cell lines except for the A549 cell line. Considering the cutoff point of 4 µg/ml for potential anticancer compounds
20 , values below this set point were obtained for this compound in HCT116 (IC 50 3.24 µg/ml), K562 (IC 50 2.25 µg/ml) and MCF7 (IC 50 2.87 µg/ml), indicating that polygonumins A could be defined as an anticancer compound. Polygonumins A was most effective against K562 (human leukaemia cell line), with an IC 50 of 2.25 µg/ml, lower than that of doxorubicin (2.97 µg/ml), highlighting the anti-leukaemia potential of polygonumins A. It has been well observed that leukaemia is more sensitive to chemotherapy than other malignancies are
21, 22 .
